newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-NZ WIN TOSS AND BAT AGAINST ENGLAND.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-NZ WIN TOSS AND BAT AGAINST ENGLAND.

text.p: New Zealand won the toss and chose to bat on Thursday in the first of five one-day cricket internationals against England.
New Zealand left out fast bowler Geoff Allott, while England have made one change from the team that won the third test, and the series 2-0, on the same ground two days ago.
Left-arm fast-medium bowler Alan Mullally replaced Andrew Caddick in the tourists' attack.
An enthusiastic capacity crowd of 25,000 filled Lancaster Park for the first day-night international to be played at the Christchurch ground.
New Zealand: Bryan Young, Nathan Astle, Adam Parore, Stephen Fleming, Chris Cairns, Lee Germon (captain), Chris Harris, Dipak Patel, Gavin Larsen, Simon Doull, Heath Davis.
England: Mike Atherton (captain), Nick Knight, Alec Stewart, Nasser Hussain, Graham Thorpe, John Crawley, Dominic Cork, Robert Croft, Darren Gough, Alan Mullally, Phil Tufnell.
